darkcircles.title: Dark circles
darkcircles.summary: Dark circles are often linked to fatigue, dehydration, and screen strain. These organic tips can help support healthier under-eye skin.
tips: Apply chilled cucumber slices on closed eyes for 10 minutes.
Use cold green tea bags or pads under the eyes for 10 minutes to reduce puffiness.
Sleep at least 7–8 hours at night and keep a regular sleep schedule.
Reduce late-night screen time and follow the 20-20-20 rule for eye breaks.
Drink at least 6–8 glasses of water daily to stay hydrated.

blepharitis.title: Blepharitis
blepharitis.summary: Blepharitis is eyelid inflammation. Gentle hygiene and warm compresses can help relieve discomfort.
tips: Use a warm, clean compress over closed eyes for about 10 minutes.
Gently clean the eyelid margins with a soft cloth and mild, diluted cleanser.
Avoid using eye makeup until the eyelids feel more comfortable.
Keep hands and towels clean to avoid further irritation around the eyes.

conjunctivitis.title: Eye irritation (conjunctivitis-like signs)
conjunctivitis.summary: For mild irritation, gentle cooling and clean surroundings can support comfort. Always seek medical advice if redness or pain increases.
tips: Use a clean, cold compress over closed eyes for short periods.
Wash hands frequently and avoid rubbing or touching the eyes.
Change pillowcases and face towels regularly to keep them clean.
Avoid sharing towels, makeup, or eye products with others.

cataracts.title: Possible cataract signs
cataracts.summary: Lifestyle changes and eye protection can support overall eye health. For cataracts, regular check-ups with an eye specialist are very important.
tips: Wear UV-protective sunglasses when going outdoors in bright sunlight.
Include leafy green vegetables and carrots in your meals for natural antioxidants.
Avoid smoking and second-hand smoke as much as possible.
Schedule regular eye check-ups with a qualified eye specialist for proper guidance.

normal.title: Healthy eyes (normal)
normal.summary: Your eyes appear normal in this scan. These simple daily habits can help you maintain good eye health.
tips: Follow the 20-20-20 rule: every 20 minutes, look 20 feet away for 20 seconds.
Sleep 7–8 hours to give your eyes enough rest.
Keep screens at a comfortable distance and avoid very bright or very dim lighting.
Stay hydrated during the day to support overall eye comfort.
